item.title: WhatsApp flaw can let attackers run malicious code on Windows PCs
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Meta warned Windows users to update the WhatsApp messaging app to the latest version to patch a vulnerability that can let attackers execute malicious code on their devices. [...]

item.title: New Mirai botnet behind surge in TVT DVR exploitation
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A significant spike in exploitation attempts targeting TVT NVMS9000 DVRs has been detected, peaking on April 3, 2025, with over 2,500 unique IPs scanning for vulnerable devices. [...]

item.title: AWS rolls out ML-KEM to secure TLS from quantum threats
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Amazon Web Services (AWS) has added support for the ML-KEM post-quantum key encapsulation mechanism to AWS Key Management Service (KMS), AWS Certificate Manager (ACM), and AWS Secrets Manager, making TLS connections more secure. [...]

item.title: EncryptHub's dual life: Cybercriminal vs Windows bug-bounty researcher
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: EncryptHub, a notorious threat actor linked to breaches at 618 organizations, is believed to have reported two Windows zero-day vulnerabilities to Microsoft, revealing a conflicted figure straddling the line between cybercrime and security research. [...]

item.title: Microsoft delays WSUS driver sync deprecation indefinitely
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft announced today that, based on customer feedback, it will indefinitely delay removing driver synchronization in Windows Server Update Services (WSUS). [...]

item.title: Six arrested for AI-powered investment scams that stole $20 million
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Spain's police arrested six individuals behind a large-scale cryptocurrency investment scam that used AI tools to generate deepfake ads featuring popular public figures to lure people. [...]

item.title: Everest ransomware's dark web leak site defaced, now offline
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The dark web leak site of the Everest ransomware gang has apparently been hacked over the weekend by an unknown attacker and is now offline. [...]

item.title: Google fixes Android zero-days exploited in attacks, 60 other flaws
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Google has released patches for 62 vulnerabilities in Android's April 2025 security update, including two zero-days exploited in targeted attacks. [...]

item.title: Malicious VSCode extensions infect Windows with cryptominers
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Nine VSCode extensions on Microsoft's Visual Studio Code Marketplace pose as legitimate development tools while infecting users with the XMRig cryptominer to mine Ethereum and Monero. [...]

item.title: Food giant WK Kellogg discloses data breach linked to Clop ransomware
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: US food giant WK Kellogg Co is warning employees and vendors that company data was stolen during the 2024 Cleo data theft attacks. [...]

item.title: Windows 11 24H2 blocked on PCs with code-obfuscation driver BSODs
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has introduced a new Windows 11 24H2 safeguard hold for systems running security or enterprise software using SenseShield Technology's sprotect.sys driver. [...]

item.title: This $16 AdGuard plan protects your whole family from malicious ads
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: You have until April 27 at 11:59 p.m. PT to grab lifetime access to AdGuard's privacy and ad-blocking tools for just $15.97 (reg. $169)—remember to enter code FAMPLAN at checkout for this limited-time discount. [...]

item.title: E-ZPass toll payment texts return in massive phishing wave
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: An ongoing phishing campaign impersonating E-ZPass and other toll agencies has surged recently, with recipients receiving multiple iMessage and SMS texts to steal personal and credit card information. [...]

item.title: OpenAI tests watermarking for ChatGPT-4o Image Generation model
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: OpenAI is reportedly testing a new "watermark" for the Image Generation model, which is a part of the ChatGPT 4o model. [...]
